attributes.action: Allow British Humanist Association accredited celebrants to carry out legally recognised marriage ceremonies in England and Wales
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: According to the 2001 census, 15.5% of the population is non-religious. A Home Office survey in 2004 found that 22% of people who responded stated that they were of no faith and other surveys have found 65% of young people declaring themselves as atheist or agnostic. (Sourced from the BHA website, 06/10/2007.) The British Humanist Association accredits only those individuals who have satisfied exhaustive criteria, who have undergone relevant training and who have passed the exam at the end of that training. Humanist Society of Scotland celebrants have been performing legal marriage ceremonies since 2005.
